review: and, it's a no brainer for simple streaming.  I bought directly from google when it was initially announced, and it worked right out of the box.  I find it more useful for local content stored such as home videos:  To access files hosted on the computer and play them on a Chromecast-enabled TV, a Chrome user simply needs to access their file directory by hitting Ctrl+O (or Command+O on a Mac) and select the desired video file. Voila! Playback., but youtube is just as easy.  For Netflix, get yourself a current gen device (bluray, receiver, etc.) that supports Super HD (for netflix) and you'll be much happier.  The beauty of this little device resides in it's quick streaming function from a tablet or phone, and if you happen to be on your laptop.  Trying to use it as an external monitor for browsing leaves a lot to be desired, so don't plan on that.  Roku is great, but much more expensive..
